candidates.title: chore: update to 2024 edition and deps
candidates.body:
This pull request introduces several updates across multiple files to enhance CI workflows, update dependencies, and improve code quality and testing. Key changes include adding new CI jobs for Rust checks, updating dependencies and Rust edition in `Cargo.toml`, and refactoring test code for better readability and functionality.

### CI Workflow Enhancements:
* [`.github/workflows/ci.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR4-R5): Added a new job for Rust checks, including `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy`, and set `RUSTFLAGS` to enforce warnings as errors. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR4-R5) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR17-R25)
* [`.github/workflows/super_lint.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L7-R7): Updated Super Linter to version `7.4.0` and disabled Rust validation temporarily until Rust `1.85`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L7-R7) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L20-R27)

### Dependency and Environment Updates:
* [`Cargo.toml`](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L4-R4): Updated Rust edition to `2024` and bumped versions of dependencies like `russh`, `russh-sftp`, `thiserror`, and `tokio`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L4-R4) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L19-R22)
* [`tests/async-ssh2-tokio/Dockerfile`](diffhunk://#diff-45cccc8345eae9ddcae5cc9ed35d6dc3f8bcee12d04d44aeeb98440defe9ed95L1-R1): Updated the Rust base image to `1.85.0`.

### Code Quality Improvements:
* [`src/client.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L670-R675): Refactored test code to replace `expect` with `unwrap_or_else` for better error handling and removed unnecessary references in function calls. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L670-R675) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L904-R903) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L917-R916) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L1103-R1102)

### Miscellaneous:
* [`tests/docker-compose.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-e63f0ca35966a726ffc6894c07d1fe38b1870304c71f615e9cd404789c357732L2): Minor formatting adjustments to the file.

candidates.title: chore: bump version to 0.8.15
candidates.body:
- Bump patch version from 0.8.14 to 0.8.15
- Update version in README.md install instructions

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

candidates.title: fix: guard publickeyfile not supported on windows target
candidates.body: Guards PublicKeyFile on windows builds as its not available. Fixes issue #83 @Miyoshi-Ryota if you wouldn't mind reviewing. Thanks!

candidates.title: fix ci error
candidates.body:
* fix ci errors
* chore: remove unused library. this is not required from rust v1.75.0.

candidates.title: bump dependencies to latest version
candidates.body:
- bump russh to 0.51.1 from 0.45.0
- replace `russh-keys` with `russh::keys` [v0.50.0](https://github.com/Eugeny/russh/releases/tag/v0.50.0)
- bump russh-sftp to 2.0.8 from 2.0.1
- bump thiserror to 2.0 from 1.0

update test env:
- update rust image to `1.81`

candidates.title: Update Russh
candidates.body: Updated russh and russh-keys to `0.45.0` to address vulnerability

candidates.title: Update Russh Dependencies
candidates.body:
- Updated the russh and russh-keys dependencies to 0.43.0
- Updated the russh-sftp dependency to 2.0.1 which depends on russh 0.43.0
- Updated the Handler implementation to match the new trait definition

candidates.title: Release upload file
candidates.body:
To release #59, I do following tasks.
- Add a unit test
- Add a document
- Cleanup a dependency
- Increment version

candidates.title: Implement upload file
candidates.body:
# What

This PR:
- Implements the ability to copy file contents from locally to remote using SFTP

# Misc

Related to https://github.com/Miyoshi-Ryota/async-ssh2-tokio/issues/14

candidates.title: Terrapin vulnerability
candidates.body: Russh v0.40.1 and earlier and vulnerable to Terrapin. This pull request bumps the russh dependency to v0.40.2

candidates.title: release 0.8.0
candidates.body:
This release includes the following improvements

- Client now implements the clone trait; Client is now cloneable.
- Server validity checks using known_hosts now support domain name access.

These contributions were made by @cybersoulK (https://github.com/cybersoulK). Again, thanks are due to cybersoulK. Thank you very much.

candidates.title: Update dependency russh: 0.37.0-beta.1 -> 0.38.0
candidates.body: This solves the issue with russh 0.37.x depending on [insecure versions of ed25519-dalek](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0093).

candidates.title: Key Auth and Server Checking
candidates.body:
Added options for key authentication from file or string with optional passphrase.
Added options for checking sever key from file or string.
Added scripts for testing with local sshd or local debugging sshd.
Upgraded ssh test docker due to lingering concurrent test issues with older sshd.
Added tests for new features and added keys to test dockers.
Upgraded russh version for required fix for keys with passphrase.

candidates.title: Russh upgrade, connect revert
candidates.body:
Upgraded to russh version that properly closes channels, permitting unlimited sequential executes over a single connection. The aforementioned limit on open channels still applies and restricts the number of simultaneous executes.

Went back to using `connect` as the constructor. This was a breaking change so I bumped the minor version.

I have another PR almost ready to go for key authentication and server checking that will have more breaking changes to the constructor (connect) method. If you prefer to combine the two together so there is only one version bump, let me know.

candidates.title: Version 0.4.0 rework
candidates.body:
I have improved the ergonomics and documentation of this crate. This is obviously a breaking change and I have thus bumped the version to 0.4.0. After your review of #12 I've changed some more stuff.

I'm open to discussion to any change I've made, discussion can only lead to better code.

* The client now takes `ToSocketAddrs` as a address
* Preferred the use of `&str` arguments over String for ergonomics
* The client can now execute multiple commands. See #12 
* The client now connects in the constructor. See https://github.com/Miyoshi-Ryota/async-ssh2-tokio/issues/12 for the disucssion
* Every public types should now have documentation
* Some more tests where added, the docs test are now compile only
* Tests can now also be run locally without docker by setting environment variables
* The Error type was renamed to fit the ecosystem style
* Reexport the common types in the top level module
* The readme was updated with links to the docs
* This is a breaking change from 0.3.0 and previous 0.4.0 commits

chosen_pr.title: chore: update to 2024 edition and deps
chosen_pr.body:
This pull request introduces several updates across multiple files to enhance CI workflows, update dependencies, and improve code quality and testing. Key changes include adding new CI jobs for Rust checks, updating dependencies and Rust edition in `Cargo.toml`, and refactoring test code for better readability and functionality.

### CI Workflow Enhancements:
* [`.github/workflows/ci.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR4-R5): Added a new job for Rust checks, including `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy`, and set `RUSTFLAGS` to enforce warnings as errors. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR4-R5) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR17-R25)
* [`.github/workflows/super_lint.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L7-R7): Updated Super Linter to version `7.4.0` and disabled Rust validation temporarily until Rust `1.85`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L7-R7) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L20-R27)

### Dependency and Environment Updates:
* [`Cargo.toml`](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L4-R4): Updated Rust edition to `2024` and bumped versions of dependencies like `russh`, `russh-sftp`, `thiserror`, and `tokio`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L4-R4) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L19-R22)
* [`tests/async-ssh2-tokio/Dockerfile`](diffhunk://#diff-45cccc8345eae9ddcae5cc9ed35d6dc3f8bcee12d04d44aeeb98440defe9ed95L1-R1): Updated the Rust base image to `1.85.0`.

### Code Quality Improvements:
* [`src/client.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L670-R675): Refactored test code to replace `expect` with `unwrap_or_else` for better error handling and removed unnecessary references in function calls. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L670-R675) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L904-R903) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L917-R916) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L1103-R1102)

### Miscellaneous:
* [`tests/docker-compose.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-e63f0ca35966a726ffc6894c07d1fe38b1870304c71f615e9cd404789c357732L2): Minor formatting adjustments to the file.
